Class bartMachine_e_gibbs_base

java.lang.Object
bartMachine.Classifier
bartMachine.bartMachine_a_base
bartMachine.bartMachine_b_hyperparams
bartMachine.bartMachine_c_debug
bartMachine.bartMachine_d_init
bartMachine.bartMachine_e_gibbs_base
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
bartMachine_f_gibbs_internal
public abstract class bartMachine_e_gibbs_base extends bartMachine_d_init implements Serializable
This portion of the code performs everything in the Gibbs sampling except for the posterior sampling itself
See Also:

      Builds a BART model by unleashing the Gibbs sampler

      Build in class Classifier

    • DoGibbsSampling

      protected void DoGibbsSampling()
      Run the Gibbs sampler for the total number of samples prespecified while flushing unneeded memory from the previous sample

      protected void DoOneGibbsSample()

    • GibbsSampleDebugMessage

      protected void GibbsSampleDebugMessage(int t)
      Print a Gibbs sample debug message

    • SampleMusWrapper

      protected void SampleMusWrapper(int sample_num, int t)
      A wrapper for sampling the mus (mean predictions at terminal nodes). This function implements part of the "residual diffing" explained in the paper.
      Parameters:
      sample_num - The current sample number of the Gibbs sampler
      t - The tree index number in 1...num_trees See Section 3.1 of Kapelner, A and Bleich, J. bartMachine: A Powerful Tool for Machine Learning in R. ArXiv e-prints, 2013

    • SampleSigsq

      protected void SampleSigsq(int sample_num, double[] es)
      A wrapper that is responsible for drawing variance values
      Parameters:
      sample_num - The current sample number of the Gibbs sampler
      es - The vector of residuals at this point in the Gibbs chain

    • getResidualsFromFullSumModel

      protected double[] getResidualsFromFullSumModel(int sample_num, double[] R_j)
      This function calculates the residuals from the sum-of-trees model using the diff trick explained in the paper
      Parameters:
      sample_num - The current sample number of the Gibbs sampler
      R_j - The residuals of the model save the last tree's contribution
      Returns:
      The vector of residuals at this point in the Gibbs chain See Section 3.1 of Kapelner, A and Bleich, J. bartMachine: A Powerful Tool for Machine Learning in R. ArXiv e-prints, 2013

    • SampleTree

      protected double[] SampleTree(int sample_num, int t, bartMachineTreeNode[] trees, TreeArrayIllustration tree_array_illustration)
      A wrapper for sampling one tree during the Gibbs sampler
      Parameters:
      sample_num - The current sample number of the Gibbs sampler
      t - The current tree to be sampled
      trees - The trees in this Gibbs sampler
      tree_array_illustration - The tree array (for debugging purposes only)
      Returns:
      The responses minus the sum of the trees' contribution up to this point

    • drawSigsqFromPosterior

      protected abstract double drawSigsqFromPosterior(int sample_num, double[] es)

    • metroHastingsPosteriorTreeSpaceIteration

      protected abstract bartMachineTreeNode metroHastingsPosteriorTreeSpaceIteration(bartMachineTreeNode copy_of_old_jth_tree, int t, boolean[][] accept_reject_mh, char[][] accept_reject_mh_steps)

    • assignLeafValsBySamplingFromPosteriorMeanAndSigsqAndUpdateYhats
